Women with a history of gestational diabetes are at very high risk for developing type 2 diabetes and require screening at least every 3 years following delivery.
Glycemic targets in pregnancy include premeal plasma glucose <95 mg/dL, 1-hour postprandial values <140 mg/dL, and 2-hour postprandial values <120 mg/dL.
Try lifestyle interventions as initial treatment, with the addition of insulin if glycemic targets are not met.
Management strategies in pregnant women with diabetes are different from those in other patients with diabetes:
Insulin should replace oral hypoglycemic agents.

A comprehensive eye examination should be completed once per trimester.
